sentences.sContent: That vibration can then be coupled to another structure to turn a rotor, which in turn operates a flagellum-like tail.
sentences.sContent_eng: That vibration can then be coupled to another structure to turn a rotor, which in turn operates a flagellum-like tail.
sentences.sCn: 这个颤动能够随即作用到另一个装置以启动马达，后者接着操纵像鞭毛一样的尾巴。

sentences.sContent: Using special stains, one can see that some bacteria have attached to them wavy-looking “hairs” called flagella. Others have only one flagellum.
sentences.sContent_eng: Using special stains, one can see that some bacteria have attached to them wavy-looking “hairs” called flagella. Others have only one flagellum.
sentences.sCn: 用特殊的着色剂后，你会发现有的细菌上长着不少波状的"毛发"即鞭毛，而有的细菌只有一根鞭毛。

sentences.sContent: Thefinal evolution of the flagellum might then have involved only thenovel recombination of sophisticated parts that initially evolved forother purposes.
sentences.sContent_eng: Thefinal evolution of the flagellum might then have involved only thenovel recombination of sophisticated parts that initially evolved forother purposes.
sentences.sCn: 鞭毛的最终出现，可能仅仅来自本来向其它方向进化的复杂器官的重新组合。

words.tran: 鞭状的；[生物] 有鞭毛的
生有鞭毛的；生有匍匐茎的

trans.tranOther: a long whiplike outgrowth from a cell that acts as an organ of locomotion: occurs in some protozoans, gametes, spores, etc
